meanings.definition: A person who is excessively concerned with following rules and procedures in their job, often to the annoyance of others.
meanings.sent1: The jobsworths at the office always insist on strict adherence to the company policies.
meanings.sent2: The team was frustrated with the jobsworths who refused to bend the rules even in minor situations.
meanings.sent3: The jobsworths insisted on filling out a form in triplicate just to borrow a stapler!
meanings.sent4: Dealing with the jobsworths felt like trying to navigate a maze with invisible walls.
meanings.sent5: The image of the jobsworths meticulously checking every detail was etched in their minds.

meanings.definition: Plural form of jobsworth, referring to multiple individuals who exhibit the same behavior.
meanings.sent1: The office was filled with jobsworths, each one more rigid than the last.
meanings.sent2: When the jobsworths gathered, it was a symphony of rule-following and bureaucracy.
meanings.sent3: The jobsworths formed a club where the main activity was discussing office regulations.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of jobsworths, standing out for creativity was a challenge.
meanings.sent5: The room buzzed with the presence of the jobsworths, all focused on their individual tasks.
